III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
R 400.4128 Initial staff orientation and ongoing staff training.
(3) The licensee shall document that each staff person whose
function is covered by these rules has participated in a minimum
of 50 clock hours of planned training within the first year of
employment and a minimum of 25 clock hours of training
annually thereafter related to the employee’s job function. At
least 16 of the 50 hours provided in the first year shall be
orientation provided prior to the assumption of duties.
One out of three employee records reviewed employed longer than one year did not
have the required 25 hours of annual training. The employee had 11 ½ hours of
annual training documented.
R 400.4156 Institutions not detention institutions or shelter care
institutions; updated treatment plan.
(3) The updated treatment plan shall include all of the following
information:
(d) For youth who are permanent court wards or MCI wards,
there must be documented co-ordination with the agency
assigned to complete adoption or permanency planning for the
youth.
One out of three applicable case records reviewed did not contain documentation of
coordination with the assigned adoption agency for an MCI ward resident.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an ISEP violation. Please note that there
are additional ISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The
facility is in compliance will all additional ISEP requirements except for the
following:
No ISEP citations are noted.

note that there are additional DHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not

The facility was not offered technical assistance.

V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
R 400.4146 Immunizations.
(2) If documentation of immunizations is unavailable,
immunizations shall begin within 30 calendar days of admission,
unless a statement from a physician indicating that
immunizations are contraindicated is included in the resident’s
record.
One case record reviewed indicates the resident refusing to be physically examined
by medical professionals on 05/29 and 05/31/2019. The Michigan Care
Improvement Registry states “no records found” regarding immunizations for the
resident. It is recommended that the facility coordinate a plan with the DHHS for the
resident to receive all required medical assessments, as well as required
immunizations.
6

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There was one substantiated incident of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
SIR#2018C0219064 initiated on 08/14/2018 resulted in the substantiation of physical
discipline when a staff began punching a resident after being repeatedly punched by
the resident, as well as restraint technique and staff failure to implement restraint
when needed. Corrective action included the immediate suspension and termination
of the staff person involved, as well as training regarding appropriate technique and
implementation for restraint.
The facility has submitted four acceptable corrective action plans not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period.
The facility submitted a corrective action plan for the 08/29/2018 interim inspection
report. The corrective action plan successfully addressed the following citations as
no repeats are noted: Annually updated central registry checks and annually updated
TB tests for staff, documentation of legal right to provide care, chief administrator
annual assessment, and prudent parenting trained staff on site. There are no repeat
citations noted.
SIR#2019C0219007 initiated on 12/21/2018 substantiated the facility for failing to
immediately contact the assigned worker or birth parent when the resident required
inpatient hospitalization. Corrective action included additional policy related training
to staff. No repeat citations are noted.
SIR#2019C0219008 initiated on 12/27/2018 substantiated the facility for staff abilities
when staff grabbed hold of a resident by the shirt while escalated. The staff person
involved was suspended and then terminated employment. Corrective action
included additional training for all staff regarding crisis intervention techniques. No
repeat citations are noted.
SIR#2019C0219020 initiated on 02/20/2019 substantiated the facility for failing to
transfer a resident’s medications to his new placement after a stay in the hospital.
Corrective action included additional staff training regarding medication transfers. No
repeat citations are noted.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or ISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon receipt of an
acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility will be issued a
renewal of their regular license.
